lines.text:
[Toast]
Here's to the poor men we love and the rich men we marry.
Oh, you do love me, don't you?
Love you? I'm crazy about you. Do you love me?
When you hold me like this, I-I'm just gaga.
Oh, don't be a silly goose!
Oh, Dick, you're a darling!
Where in the name of Six Continents did I put those slippers?

[Sternly]
Tommy! Make your hands behave!
have you alone all summer idea? What did she mean by that?
Now, don't worry, precious. I'll just run along home and pay a little visit.
Yes and Stribbling will be making love to you.
Oh, don't think about him, darling. He's harmless.
Goodbye.
Goodbye. Oh, darling!
Dickie!
[Long kiss]
Gee, I'll have to work overtime when I start buying you those pretty doodads.
That's me. That's me. When I fall, I break a leg.
Dick, please!
Did you hear what they said?
No, what was it?
Well, just before he left, he told her to meet him tomorrow night at the studio at nine o'clock.
Oh, yes?
She never seemed like that kind of a girl.
Well, maybe I'm wrong, Matty; but, I don't think so. And I'm going to find out.

You don't seem to have anything on your mind but a lot of nonsense. Golf. Tennis. Running around all day and, at night, parties. Dancing your feet off. I think its about time you thought of the serious things of life.
Wasn't that cute of me?
No! I think you're just too fresh!
Oh, Dick. Oh, I'm so happy you're here.
Atta baby!

Now, then, young lady, what do you mean by running off and marrying this young whippersnapper without telling your mother or father about it? And you, young man, what do you mean by stealing into my family, like a porch climber, and marrying my daughter secretly?

Why, you're nothing but a pair of silly children. You think you can defy all the conventions established by long experience and wisdom, just to protect you from your own ignorant little folly. But, you can't get away with it. There's always a penalty!
[last lines]
Sweetheart, are we - half married?
No, we're all married.

[singing]
Lonely hearts will be gay, bluebirds will fly, after the clouds roll by...
I wish things were different.
Oh, but, Dick!
